metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19200 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in uriparser before 0.9.0. UriCommon.c allows attempted operations on NULL input via a uriResetUri* function. It was discovered that uriparser mishandled certain input. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause uriparser to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liburiparser1 - 0.9.3-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: uriparser package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.3-2').
